title: Magnetic field - doubling radius of circular wire

content.question: A battery produces a current within a circular loop of wire of radius <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> and total resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The magnetic field at the center of the loop has magnitude <math alttext="B sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If the wire was longer such that the radius of the loop was doubled with the same battery attached, what would be the magnitude of the magnetic field produced at the center of the loop?

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
